entries.text: Thank you for calling VeloFit customer support. My name is Ashley, and I'll be assisting you today. How can I help you?
Hi Ashley, I'm calling about a return. I recently ordered a pair of cycling shoes and some tires, but they don't seem to be the right fit for me.
I understand. Can you please provide me with your order number so I can pull up your information?
Thank you. I see your order here. Before we proceed, could you confirm whether the shoes or tires have been mounted or installed?
Yeah, I did mount the tires to my wheels to see how they felt, and I also installed the cleats on the shoes and tried them on the trainer. I noticed some cleat marks after I put the cleats on.

Thank you for that information. Unfortunately, because the tires have been mounted and the shoes have visible cleat marks, indicating they have been used, we are unable to accept the return. Items must be in new, unused condition to be eligible for a return. Once tires have been installed, the dirty tires prevent us from accepting them back as new. Similarly, shoes with cleat marks and evidence of use, we cannot resell. Our return policy, which can be found on our website, details these conditions.
Oh, I see. I didn't realize that. I thought I could try them out and return them if they didn't work.

I understand. While we want you to be completely satisfied with your VeloFit purchase, we have this policy in place to ensure that all returned items are truly in new and sellable condition for our other customers. Perhaps we can offer you a discount on a future purchase to compensate for the inconvenience?
Actually, that’s okay. I understand your policy now that you explained it. I appreciate you taking the time to clarify it for me. I guess I'll try to sell them myself.
You're very welcome. I'm glad I could help. Is there anything else I can assist you with today?
Thank you for calling VeloFit. Have a great day!
